list_definition.definition: to accept (a duty, task, responsibility etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has undertaken to have the work finished by the end of the month.

list_ex_of_english: Thus, we undertook to examine the effect of various approaches to allocating cost when multiple diagnoses are listed for hospitalizations.
The task was formidable but has been undertaken successfully.
Adequately identifying and effectively measuring all relevant consumptive and non-consumptive values of varying stockholders is a non-trivial and complex matter, but it must be undertaken.
In closing, however, let me provide a reminder of the character of the exercise we have undertaken.
All observations and experiments, except those dealing with phenological synchronization with the host, were undertaken in the laboratory.
The complete solution of these fundamental equations requires a numerical investigation of considerable complexity which has not been undertaken.
Several graptolite studies have been undertaken in the area.
Given that such an exercise is not costless, it is only worth undertaking if the benefit from doing so outweighs the costs.
